RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.

ExploreFact.Text: Mica says that sand hasn't been flowing between the Hourglass Twins for some time.
According to Chert, sand would start flowing between the Hourglass Twins again on the morning of my launch day.
Mica isn't sure how Chert knows when sand flows between the Hourglass Twins.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
I used my Little Scout to look inside the drain behind the waterwheel, but the museum shard wasn't in there.
Tephra asked me to explore the Nomai Ruins outside the village to see if the museum shard was traveling there. They warned me about ghost matter in that area.

ExploreFact.Text: Tephra and Galena noticed the quantum shard in the museum disappearing completely sometimes. They wondered where it went when it disappeared completely.
Tephra asked me to use my Little Scout to check if the museum shard was inside the drain behind the village waterwheel.

AltText.Text: I used my Little Scout to look for the museum shard inside the drain behind the waterwheel.

ExploreFact.Text: Tephra says that until we figure out another way to see where the museum shard goes, we've hit a dead end.

AltText.Text: Tephra asked me to explore the Nomai Ruins outside the village to see if the museum shard was traveling there. They warned me about ghost matter in that area.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
Galena wonders how much of Brittle Hollow left after the meteor storm ends.

ExploreFact.Text: Galena wonders how much of Brittle Hollow left after the meteor storm ends.
According to Riebeck, the meteor storm has lasted for weeks, and might start to break apart Brittle Hollow.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.
Arkose says that Gabbro was the one who told them that ghost matter disappears.

ExploreFact.Text: Arkose says that the ghost matter in the village sometimes doesn't leave a glowing trail when something was thrown into it.
According to Gabbro, ghost matter disappears sometimes.
Gabbro asked me to tell Arkose about how water neutralizes ghost matter.

RumorFact.Text: Slate asked me to hear out what questions the kids in the village have about the universe.

ExploreFact.Text: For some reason, Moraine asked me how many comets there were in the star system.
Moraine says they saw two comets in the sky one night. They were sure it was a second comet, but they haven't been able to find it again since.

RumorFact.Text: My Little Scout traveled with the museum’s quantum shard into a glittering cave somewhere within Timber Hearth.
The Nomai built the Sanctuary using ore mined on Timber Hearth.
The Nomai used a new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop to enter the Sanctuary.
The Hearthians that survived the arrival of ghost matter within the Sanctuary were quarantined inside by a Nomai named Cassava.
A Nomai named Yarrow wrote to the Sanctuary about the failure of the Ash Twin Project.

ExploreFact.Text: A Sanctuary built to protect Timber Hearth's native life during the operation of the Ash Twin Project.
A Nomai named Cassava was horrified to discover that the native species of Timber Hearth had been gravely endangered by ghost matter due to their amphibious nature.
Cassava quarantined the species within the Sanctuary. He resolved to launch the Inspired towards Timber Hearth (after necessary adjustments) to protect them.
I found an Ash Twin projection stone inside the Sanctuary, but was unable to read the text on the projection wall.

AltText.Text: A Nomai named Yarrow wrote to the Sanctuary about the failure of the Ash Twin Project.

ExploreFact.Text: A memory statue aboard the Ash Twin Project erroneously paired with Yarrow. This was later learned to be caused by some sort of safeguard.

RumorFact.Text: A Nomai named Cassava traveled to Timber Hearth to study a second property of ghost matter.
A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter in this site being pulled up by the Attlerock’s gravity as it orbited overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: The Nomai ruins at this site were known as a warp receiver.
After a Nomai has warped to it and the warp pad is clear of any entities, a warp receiver powers a return warp that allows travel to its paired warp transmitter once.
The Nomai on Timber Hearth were careful not to leave this warp receiver powered to protect the planet's native life from being warped to Ash Twin.
There is a scroll in a toppled shelf here, but it is surrounded by ghost matter.

AltText.Text: A Nomai named Cassava observed ghost matter rising as the Attlerock orbited overhead.

ExploreFact.Text: Cassava posited that ghost matter could be competitively manipulated by sources of gravity. This discovery was named the 'property of attraction'.

RumorFact.Text: There is a Nomai campsite on the path from the Nomai Ruins into the geyser mountain.

ExploreFact.Text: This campsite belonged to the Nomai working on Timber Hearth.
Ore mined on Timber Hearth was used in the construction of the Sanctuary and the Ash Twin Project.
A new invention from the Scroll and Stone Workshop was used to enter the Sanctuary, in place of a warp receiver.
The Nomai visited the pools outside mining site 2b to study a native species of Timber Hearth.
I found Nomai text warning of danger invisible to the naked eye beyond a barricade.
